meanings.sent1: Her demeanour at the party was friendly and welcoming.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's demeanour in class is always calm and patient.
meanings.sent3: His serious demeanour at the comedy show made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Despite her tough demeanour, she was actually very kind-hearted.
meanings.sent5: The dog's demeanour changed from playful to protective when a stranger approached.

meanings.definition: Appearance or manner of carrying oneself
meanings.sent1: His demeanour in a suit and tie gave off a professional vibe.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's demeanour before the race showed confidence and determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat's elegant demeanour while walking on the fence was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a grand demeanour, standing tall and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The queen's regal demeanour commanded respect from all who met her.
